bibdata.title: IEEE Draft Standard for Safety Levels with Respect to Human Exposure to Radio Frequency Electromagnetic Fields, 3 kHz to 300 GHz
Amendment: Specifies Ceiling Limits for Induced and Contact Current, Clarifies Distinctions between Localized Exposure and Spatial Peak Power Density

IEEE Draft Standard for Safety Levels with Respect to Human Exposure to Radio Frequency Electromagnetic Fields, 3 kHz to 300 GHz - Amendment: Specifies Ceiling Limits for Induced and Contact Current, Clarifies Distinctions between Localized Exposure and Spatial Peak Power Density
bibdata.docidentifier: IEEE Unapproved Draft Std PC95.1a/D1.4, Jun 2009

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers

bibdata.abstract: This amendment to IEEE Std C95.1-2005 specifies ceiling values for induced and contact current, clarifies the distinctions between localized exposure and spatial peak power density, and corrects other known technical and editorial errors.

organization.name: Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers
